title: Daddy Day Care
content:
daddy day care is a comedy about 2 dad who start their own day care centre who known nothing about running a day care centre & eventually all hell break loose, i not gonna tell you anymore you will have to see it for yourself

[url=http://www.sonypictures.com/movies/daddydaycare/site/]www.sonypictures.com/movi...care/site/[/url][url=http://www.dosvault.tk][img]http://venus.walagata.com/w/thedosvault/sig/tdv_banner.jpg[/img][/url]

title: Re: Daddy Day Care
content: As my post above (that has disappeared and can't be restored) says; not my kind of movie. So, I have not and I won't.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Daddy Day Care
content:
I happened to see it (a long while ago now), and it wasn't particularly interesting or memorable for me.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

title: Re: Daddy Day Care
content:
Such awful, awful movies.

Isn't there ANY movie worth watching that's been released over the past few years? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] [img]http://www.geocities.com/miniopolis/soul.txt[/img]

title: Re: Daddy Day Care
content: Yes. Amlie. Well, it's four years ago, but I guess that counts. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Daddy Day Care
content:
Amlie is a great film, and really shows the quirky French film culture at its best - an entertaining adult film with a child-like curiousity to it. See, being a film critic is easy! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
My [url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?grafix5000]MindBending Power[/url] is 5.43 points.
Possibly the [url=http://legion.gibbering.net/misterx/troutwar.php?s=grafix5000]funniest thing[/url] on the interweb.
Go to [url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url] to see my site!

[img]http://www.toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: lol
content:
Well, I enjoyed The Triplets of Bevelle (I think that was the title) which was equally French, although that was animated. :-)

The only other film which sticks out in my mind is "The Incredibles" by Pixar, but I'm just the kind of guy who really enjoys those computer-animated movies.
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: lol
content:
I was going to add that, but it's not actually French. It's Belgian. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] Where I live, the film's title is Belleville Rendezvous, but it's The Triplets of Belleville elsewhere. Don't know why. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img]

title: Re: lol
content: Has anyone seen "The City Of Lost Children?"  That is a franch film by the same Frenchman who did Amelie.  It is a very bizarre film with great visuals.  A dark fairy tale about a strongman from the circus who tries to find his 'little brother' that a scary old scientific experiment stole.  Really crazy movie.*** ---   I Am Keen is hell bent for leather.  Are you?   --- ***
